question: If you could be someone else for just one day, who would it be and why?

answers.answer: My mom. I wish I could see the world as she does to understand her better.
Great smile, long and fit.
The '80s. They had a cool era and style. I couldn't go too primitive. I like my modern luxuries.
Bill Gates, just because he's so selfless and charitable. I would want to feel the gratification of donating billions of dollars to help so many people around the world. It would be the best feeling.
Tony Robbins because he hosts amazing seminars and impacts the masses.
Ellen DeGeneres because she seems to love what she does and people's days are brightened when they are around her.
President of the United States. I like being in charge of making big decisions.
Usain Bolt. It's got to feel crazy to be that athletic.
Someone less fortunate, so I appreciate my life more.
Maybe Matt Lauer so I could help people start their day off on the right foot. He seems like a genuine guy and a class act.

question: Would you describe yourself more as 'the party starter', 'the wingman' or 'the laid back one'?

answers.answer: " The wingman
" I'm more of the laid back one that turns into the party starter as the night goes on.
Depends on how many drinks I've had, lol! In all honesty, I probably start kind of laid back and work my way up to "party" status at this point in my life.
How cool would it be to travel the world going on adventures and helping people solely funded through pictures you post of living your dream life!
100% the party starter… always blowing my whistle and making NOISE!!! Let's fire it up, put on some Prince and party like it's 1999!!!!
I could be all. How about the life of the party!!
Monday through Thursday I'm the laid back one, but Friday through Sunday I'm the party starter.
Wingman historically, but I've been more outgoing with meeting new people and being more of the instigator.
" Laid back one.

question: What's the most outrageous thing you have ever done

answers.answer: Ate a live salamander
Taking a job to teach English in Indonesia with minimal preparation.
Get engaged to a crazy girl.
A trip to Cancun on Spring Break where we had a "sexual positions" contest
Skydived in the Swiss Alps.
Stripped once in high school for a friend's big sister's birthday. Fifty dollars was a lot at the time.
Skydiving! Twice
Sign a contract to play professional basketball in Bulgaria.
Live four months without power. Cold showers are no joke.

question: What kind of music do you listen to most often?

answers.answer: Coldplay, Beatles … Can't really think of a third one. Music isn't a big part of my life.
Anything with good drums!
Anything I can dance to. "Ice Ice Baby" is also one of my favorite songs because I used to sing it at Bar Mitzvahs on stage.
House, pop, hip hop, alt. Pretty much anything except metal.
EDM/Hip-hop
Elvis Presley, Britney Spears, Flo Rida
Justin Timberlake, Train, John Mayer. All three have gone their own route and still stood the test of time.
Rap and country. Yes, you read that correctly.
When I work, chill electronic with no words. When I'm just chilling, acoustic guitar sets.

question: What are your top all-time favorite movies?

answers.answer: Transformers, The Pursuit of Happyness, The Wolf of Wall Street
The Iron Giant, Moonlight, The Matrix
Friday, Devil Wears Prada, Pursuit of Happyness
Tough question! Blue Chips, Bad Boys and Equalizer
Slackers, Friday Night Lights, Grandma's Boy
Gone with the Wind, Inglourious Basterds, and Scarface
Shawshank Redemption, Star Wars, Jurassic Park.

question: Who is your favorite actor and why?

answers.answer: Jennifer Lawrence because she is every girl's goal.

Denzel Washington because from the time I watched Malcolm X he was incredible. And through the years he has told some incredible stories through film and he is an incredible human, husband, father and mentor.
Tom Hardy – dude is a beast!
Denzel Washington. Power screen presence. Complete emotional control.
Will Smith. I wanted to be as cool and smart as him growing up. Still do. Also, he just seems perpetually positive. So much respect for that.
Matthew McConaughey! He is insanely talented, accomplished and has very strong family values and dedication.
Denzel, because every movie he was in were all classics and for him to act in several different characters is very impressive.

question: If you could have lunch with one person, who would it be and why?

answers.answer: My mom. It's been over 10 years since she passed. Lunch would be amazing.
The Rock. We are very much alike.
Donald Glover. I respect him on so many levels as a musician, actor, general creative, activist and businessman. Or Ed Snowden.
Dead: Bruce Jenner, Alive: Caitlyn Jenner …. Would be a very interesting convo.
President Obama, because I want to hear what obstacles, hardship and challenges he had to face to attain the highest position in America.
Elon Musk. I'm a fan of his fearlessness.
Buddha. So I could discuss his philosophies on detachment, suffering and divinity.

question: What is the most romantic present you have ever given or received and why?

answers.answer: Threesome. It was my birthday.
A car. I like giving practical gifts.
Surprise tickets to see Beyoncé and Jay Z, because Bey and Jay = everyone's relationship goals.
An engagement ring
Different Edible Arrangements every day for a birthday week.
Lingerie. I knew I was in love once I found myself shopping at Victoria Secret.

question: What are your three best attributes?

answers.answer: I'm reliable and self-sufficient, emotionally intelligent, and generally very positive.
Affectionate/passionate, personable/charming/funny, kind/good heart
Passionate, loyal, witty
Easy to get along with, funny, driven!
Height, smile, hair – (physical), personality, public speaking
Driven, empathetic, worldly

question: What is your greatest achievement to date?

answers.answer: Getting a Fulbright Grant to teach in the Ivory Coast.
Being a GREAT big brother. Since my kid sister was born, I have taken pride in not only loving her but teaching her about life.
My greatest achievement is attending two graduate school program from two different universities simultaneously and graduating from both in the same weekend.
Building my parents a 5,000-square-foot log home on 10 acres in Montana.
Probably the 10 years I have spent as a basketball coach, volunteering and working with inner city kids.
Dominating my basketball league after college. I was Kobe back then.

question: What is your most embarrassing moment?

answers.answer: When I told my mom I was going on The Bachelorette.
When I was stranded on a toilet for hours in 5th grade
I once had a stomach bug in Peru and had to defecate in a cut open 2-liter coke bottle in the back of a tour bus.
Getting caught masturbating.
I had a mullet in 4th grade. My sister swears I wanted my hair cut that way. I like to believe that's not true. Haha.

question: What's your favorite book and why?

answers.answer: Tough. The most recent is The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle, by Haruki Murakami. It's like a dream I don't want to wake up from.
As a Man Thinketh by James Allen. Simple format for being human and living life.
Catch-22 because of the narrative style and use of real historical events. I'm also interested in WWII history.
The Power of Your Subconscious Mind. It was a gift.
The New Jim Crow. It enlightened me to a whole lot.

question: What's your favorite flower?

answers.answer: Red roses, because I am a classic gentleman.
Orchid
Tulips. Basically, roses without thorns. There's a metaphor somewhere there.
Wildflowers that grow in high altitudes, above tree lines.
Now, it's a single red rose

question: What's the most embarrassing style you've rocked?

answers.answer: JNCO Jeans!! Sooooo baggy lol. Skate or die, man!! I looked ridiculous!
As a joke, I once shaved a brain into my hair. Embarrassing, but yet awesome. It was when I took a neuroanatomy class.
No.
Chiquita Banana outfit
Blonde highlights and diamond studs. Back in my boy band phase, '90s/early 2000s.

question: Do you like to go out dancing? If yes, what is your preferred type of dancing

answers.answer: Yes, I two-step all night.
Yes, country or trap/hip hop based on mood.
No, I can't dance at all.
Love dancing. Tango, Swing, Ballroom, Russian dance, Freestyle …. and good old bump and grind.
Salsa. I love spinning the girls.

question: Who do you admire most in the world and why?

answers.answer: Admired my mom. While battling cancer, she always stayed positive and had a zest for life until the very end.
Elon Musk – different thinker, innovator
My father. He spent his entire life taking care of at-risk youth. After his first-born son committed suicide, he remained a strong head of the household.
My Mamaw! I admire how she adapts to the circumstances she faces enough to progress and successfully thrive. She survived the Depression as a kid, grew and raised an incredible family.
My parents for setting the bar when it comes to relationships as far as I'm concerned.

question: What is a typical Saturday night like for you?

answers.answer: Well if it's not with my couch, then I would go out with some friends for dinner and go out to a bar or club for drinks, maybe late night tacos.
Now, I'm trying to recover from all the day drinking! It can consist of napping to go back out or just recovering.
Going out to a cigar bar then heading down to South Beach with a group of friends
Either wrestling in my underwear in front of thousands of people or at home with my daughter.

question: What are your three worst attributes?

answers.answer: Selfish, unemotional, unapologetic
Sensitivity, procrastination, and patience.
Passionate, loyal, witty
Don't trust most people (trust is earned, not assumed), general disdain for perceived corrupt authority, I can be very blunt and outspoken, sometimes I don't think before I speak.

question: Do you consider yourself romantic and why?

answers.answer: Yes. I like to treat my significant other like a queen.
Absolutely! I'm a "pleaser" under wraps! I like to do things to make someone emotional and happy.
Kinda. I don't mind being romantic, but it can show you're weak.
Yes. When I have someone I feel is worthy they deserve to be treated like a princess.

question: Do you prefer a woman who wants to be pursued or a woman who pursues you and why?

answers.answer: I like a woman that pursues me. I like an aggressive, go-getter type.
A woman who demands to be pursued. Nothing good comes easy.
Wants to be pursued. She knows how to play the game.
I prefer a woman who pursues me. It shows that she has the focus and the courage to go for something that she wants despite the cultural expectation that the man do the pursuing.

question: What's the wildest thing you've done in the bedroom?

answers.answer: I'll just say I have virtually no limits once that connection is there.
Plead the fifth
Ex was into BDSM and introduced me to being a dom. Interesting, but don't like hurting people, so it's weird. Fun with her though.
One word: Tabasco.

question: What does your ideal mate look like?

answers.answer: I prefer fit and curvy, but I'm a sucker for a nice butt and a beautiful smile.
A model
7+. Looks matter for the ideal candidate. Any culture or skin tone. Big butt. I'm definitely a butt guy.
Belle (Beauty and The Beast), Cinderella, Little Mermaid … and the best, Jessica Rabbit!

question: Ever have trouble in the bedroom? Or been turned on during the wrong time?

answers.answer: Whenever a girl tries to bite me I have to stop everything and have a discussion.
Yes, there are times that I get aroused at work and I have to go back to my desk to avoid being noticed.
I once got a boner during a board meeting. I had to present sitting down.
There was about two weeks when I first started dating my ex that I was Quick Draw McGraw.

question: Do you prefer "hot spot" type clubs or low-key bars and why?

answers.answer: Now, I prefer low key bars! I think as a guy, you have to go through so much red tape to get into hot spots that it's annoying.
Of these two, hot spot clubs. If I'm going out, I prefer to go all out. Otherwise, having a bunch of people over and firing up the grill is my jam.
I'm more of a "dive bar" type person! I don't mind clubs, but I do prefer personal interaction and the ability to do so and a club doesn't always provide.
Hot spot clubs because I like to dance.

question: How would you describe yourself as a lover?

answers.answer: I would describe myself as an unselfish lover. I wouldn't feel satisfied unless I knew my partner was.
I ensure both of us are satisfied. Pretty open to most things. Usually last a long time (in a good way.)
Intimate, emotional, fun, supportive. If you mean specifically during sex, "athletic," lol.
Good. I like to take care of my lady first.

question: What is your ideal mate's personality like?

answers.answer: Driven and passionate about what she does.
Curious. Able to laugh at silly things, but also hold her own in an intellectual conversation.
Outgoing, people person, funny, crazy, calm, cool, loud, funny, geeky but cool like The Fonz

question: Who is your favorite artist?

answers.answer: The Rock (Dwayne Johnson)
Jean-Michel Basquiat
Dali

question: What is your favorite memory from your childhood?

answers.answer: Horseback riding camp.
When I was very young, my family lived in a mobile home. I remember sitting on top with my brothers watching a demolition derby and eating Oreos.
Meeting the Power Rangers.

question: Tattoos:

answers.answer: Besides applying for The Bachelorette, probably moving to Milan on my own for two months.
Modern Family. It's hilarious and carefree.
Will Smith because he's the Fresh Prince.

question: If you were stranded on a dessert island, what would it be made of?

answers.answer: Hot Cheetos and mint chocolate chip ice cream
Strawberry cheesecake!!!!

question: Do you have any pets and if so, what kind?

answers.answer: No pets but when I'm married with children I will own a pet lion and name him, "Denzel, the lion."
Not currently. All former dogs were over ½ wolf.
Had a dog and cat growing up. Now an ant farm, fish and I'm an uncle to a cat.

question: Do you like being the center of attention, or do you prefer being more mysterious and why?

answers.answer: I won't lie, I love attention… not like '07 B. Spears attention or 2011 Sheen. Natural attention like when Justin and Brit wore those incredible denim outfits.
Center of attention. I'm a natural born leader and people draw towards me.
Definitely not the center of attention because there is always a reason why people need attention. I'm confident in who I am as a person.

question: Meatloaf said he would "do anything for love, but he won't do that." What will you not do?

answers.answer: I will not go to jail for anyone!
There isn't anything I wouldn't do.
Be someone's second choice.

question: If you were stranded on a desert island, what 3 things would you bring with you and why? And what under any circumstances could you not tolerate on that island?

answers.answer: Water, Book of Proverbs, phone. I could not tolerate negative people.
A hook, the right girl and a fire source. That'd be all I'd need to survive and could learn how to make booze. Sand gnats!
1. Waterproof lighter 2. Spear gun 3. Cast of The View. Couldn't tolerate The Situation from Jersey Shore.

question: If you could live in any other time period, what would it be?

answers.answer: Before money was involved
The future. No need to dwell on past issues or time periods.
Ancient Egypt

question: Where is the craziest place you've had sex?

answers.answer: Just off the continental divide on a glacier in the mountains.
In my office at work!
The balcony of a cruise ship.

question: What's your worst date memory?

answers.answer: Being catfished! A girl arrived on the date pregnant!!
I went on one Tinder date a few years back. Right away I realized why I wasn't the online dating type.
Every Tinder date ever.
